briefdescription.para: Forward declaration for pImpl idiom.

detaileddescription.para: Private member to implementation pointer.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Copy constructor.
Move constructor.
Assignment operator.
Constructor.
Constructor named.
Virtual method for implementing addComponent,.
Create a Component object.

detaileddescription.para: Factory method to create a Component. Create a blank component with::

simplesect.para: A smart pointer to a Component object.

briefdescription.para: Create a Component object with a name.

detaileddescription.para: Factory method to create a Component with a name. Create a named component with name "Component" with:
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the component.

simplesect.para: A smart pointer to a Component object.

briefdescription.para: Set the source component for this component.

detaileddescription.para: Make this component an imported component by defining an import model from which to extract the named component from.

parameterdescription.para: The import source from which the named component originates.
The name of the component in the imported model to use.

briefdescription.para: Appends the argument to the math string for this component.

detaileddescription.para: Appends math to the existing math string for this component.

parameterdescription.para: The std::string to append for this component.

briefdescription.para: Get the math string for this component.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a math string if one has been appended for this component. Returns an empty string if math has not been appended (or has been removed).

briefdescription.para: Set the math string for this component.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the math string for this component. If math is an empty string, math will be removed from the component.

parameterdescription.para: The std::string to append for this component.

briefdescription.para: Clear the math from this component.

detaileddescription.para: Clears the math string from this component.

briefdescription.para: Add a variable by reference as part of this component.

detaileddescription.para: Add a variable by reference as part of the given component.

parameterdescription.para: The variable to add.

briefdescription.para: Remove the variable at the given index from this component.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the variable at the given index from this component. If the index is not valid false is returned, the valid range for the index is [0, #variables). If the variable to be removed is in a connection (is equivalent to another variable), this component will not be serialised in the connection.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the variable to remove.

simplesect.para: True if the variable was removed, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Remove the variable with the given name from this component.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the variable with the given name from this component. If the named variable to be removed is in a connection (is equivalent to another variable), this component will not be serialised in the connection.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the variable to remove.

simplesect.para: True if the variable was removed, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Remove the variable by the given variable pointer from this component.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the variable with the given pointer from this component. If the variable to be removed is in a connection (is equivalent to another variable), this component will not be serialised in the connection.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to the variable to remove.

simplesect.para: True if the variable was removed, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Remove all variables stored in this component.

detaileddescription.para: Clears all variables that have been added to this component. If any of the variables to be removed are in connections (are equivalent to other variables), this component will not be serialised in the connection.

briefdescription.para: Get a variable at index.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to a variable at the index index for this component. If the index is not valid a nullptr is returned, the valid range for the index is [0, #variables).

parameterdescription.para: The index of the variable to return.

simplesect.para: A reference to the variable at the given index on success, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a variable with the given name name.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to a variable with the name name for this component. If the name is not found a nullptr is returned.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the variable to return.

simplesect.para: A reference to the Variable with the given name on success, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Take a variable at index.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the variable at the given index from this component and returns a reference to a variable at the index index for this component. If the index is not valid a nullptr is returned, the valid range for the index is [0, #variables).

parameterdescription.para: The index of the variable to return.

simplesect.para: A reference to the variable at the given index on success, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Take a variable with the given name name.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the variable with the given name from this component and returns a reference to a variable with the name name for this component. If the name is not found a nullptr is returned.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the variable to return.

simplesect.para: A reference to the Variable with the given name on success, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of variables in the component.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of variables the component directly contains.

briefdescription.para: Test whether the argument variable is in this component.

detaileddescription.para: Tests whether the argument variable exists in the set of this component's variables. Returns true if the variable is in this component's variables and false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The variable to check for in this component.

simplesect.para: true if the variable is in this component and false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Test whether the variable named name is in this component.

detaileddescription.para: Tests whether a variable with the argument name exists in the set of this component's variables. Returns true if the named variable is in this component's variables and false otherwise.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the variable to check for in this component.

simplesect.para: true if a variable named name is in this component and false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Add a reset by reference as part of this component.

detaileddescription.para: Add a reset by reference as part of the given component.

parameterdescription.para: The reset to add.

briefdescription.para: Remove the reset at the given index from this component.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the reset at the given index from this component. If the index is not valid false is returned, the valid range for the index is [0, #resets).

parameterdescription.para: The index of the reset to remove.

simplesect.para: True if the reset was removed, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Remove the reset by the given reset pointer from this component.

detaileddescription.para: Remove the reset with the given pointer from this component.
This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to the reset to remove.

simplesect.para: True if the reset was removed, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Remove all resets stored in this component.

detaileddescription.para: Clears all resets that have been added to this component.

briefdescription.para: Get a reset at index.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to a reset at the index index for this component. If the index is not valid a nullptr is returned, the valid range for the index is [0, #resets).

parameterdescription.para: The index of the reset to return.

simplesect.para: A reference to the reset at the given index on success, nullptr otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of resets in the component.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of resets the component contains.

briefdescription.para: Test whether the argument reset is in this component.

detaileddescription.para: Tests whether the argument reset exists in the set of this component's resets. Returns true if the reset is in this component's resets and false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: The reset to check for in this component.

simplesect.para: true if the reset is in this component and false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Create a clone of this component.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a full separate copy of this component without copying the parent. Thus the cloned (returned) version of this component will not have a parent set even if this component does. Any and all child components will also be cloned recreating the full component hierarchy that this component is the root of.

simplesect.para: a new ComponentPtr to the cloned component.

briefdescription.para: The Component class.

detaileddescription.para: The Component class is for representing a CellML Component.
